It is in proportion as the heart is sanctified by grace, and filled with the active love for God and 


                         -44- 

for our fellow men, that we do nothing for show or by compulsion. Those who love God do that which is pleasant for them to do, and that is to reveal God in character, and submit the whole heart to the sanctification of the truth.--Review and Herald, No. 41, 1895.
